cancereffectsizeR 0.1.1.9006

  • Articles
    • Cancer type considerations for COSMIC signature extraction

Reference

Basic workflow

Functions to run sequentially in most analyses

CESAnalysis()

Create a cancereffectsizeR analysis

load_maf()

Load MAF-formatted somatic mutation data

trinuc_mutation_rates()

Calculate relative rates of trinucleotide-context-specific mutations by extracting underlying mutational processes

gene_mutation_rates()

Use dNdScv with tissue-specific covariates to calculate gene-level mutation rates

annotate_variants()

Annotate variants with data from genome and reference transcripts

ces_snv()

Calculate selection intensity for single-nucleotide variants and amino acid changes

trinuc_mutation_rates extensions and alternatives

Additional functions for signature extraction and determination of tumor-specific mutational processes

suggest_cosmic_v3_signatures_to_remove()

Identify mutational signatures to exclude from your analysis

assign_group_average_trinuc_rates()

Skip mutational signature analysis and assign group average relative trinucleotide-context-specific mutation rates to all samples

set_trinuc_rates()

Assign pre-calculated relative trinucleotide mutation rates

run_deconstructSigs()

cancereffectsizeR wrapper for deconstructSigs

Viewing CESAnalysis data

Data accession functions that you probably won’t need (you can use cesa$maf, cesa$samples, etc. instead)

maf_records()

View data loaded into CESAnalysis

excluded_maf_records()

View excluded MAF data

samples()

View sample metadata

get_trinuc_rates()

Get expected relative trinucleotide-specific SNV mutation rates

get_signature_weights()

Get table of signature weights by tumor

get_gene_rates()

Get table of neutral gene mutation rates by progression state

snv_results()

View results from ces_snv

Miscellaneous

set_genome_data_directory()

Assign a reference data directory to a CESAnalysis

get_genome_data_directory()

Get the path to the reference data directory of a CESAnalysis

In beta

ces_gene_epistasis()

Calculate gene-level selection intensity under an assumption of pairwise gene epistasis

gene_epistasis_results()

View results from gene-level epistasis analysis
